files.Title: WsusManager.App.App
files.Summary: WPF Application class. Handles global unhandled exception handlers. DI host and window creation are managed in Program.cs.

files.Title: WsusManager.App.Program
files.Summary: Application entry point. Sets up the DI host, resolves the main window, and runs the WPF application. All service dependencies are registered here.

files.Title: WsusManager.App.Services.IThemeService
files.Summary: Manages runtime theme switching by swapping color ResourceDictionaries in Application.Current.Resources.MergedDictionaries.

files.Title: WsusManager.App.Services.ThemeInfo
files.Summary: Theme metadata for UI binding (theme picker display names and swatch preview colors).

files.Title: WsusManager.App.Services.ThemeService
files.Summary: Singleton service that swaps color ResourceDictionaries at runtime. Identifies the current color dictionary by checking for the "PrimaryBackground" key.

files.Title: WsusManager.App.ViewModels.MainViewModel
files.Summary: Primary ViewModel for the main application window. Manages dashboard state, navigation, operation execution, log output, server mode detection, WSUS installation detection, and settings persistence. All long-running operations must go through RunOperationAsync.

files.Title: WsusManager.App.Views.GpoInstructionsDialog
files.Summary: Dialog displaying GPO deployment instructions with copyable text. Shown after GPO files are successfully copied to C:\WSUS\WSUS GPO.

files.Title: WsusManager.App.Views.InstallDialog
files.Summary: Install WSUS dialog. Collects installer path, SA username, and SA password before installation begins. Returns InstallOptions via public property.

files.Title: WsusManager.App.Views.MainWindow
files.Summary: Main application window. Constructor-only code-behind that sets DataContext from the DI-injected ViewModel. Minimal code-behind for UI-only concerns.

files.Title: WsusManager.App.Views.ScheduleTaskDialog
files.Summary: Schedule Task dialog. Collects all scheduling parameters: task name, schedule type, day, time, maintenance profile, and credentials. Returns ScheduledTaskOptions via public property.

files.Title: WsusManager.App.Views.SettingsDialog
files.Summary: Settings dialog. Allows administrators to edit server mode, refresh interval, content path, SQL instance, and theme selection without restarting the application. Returns updated AppSettings via the Result property when DialogResult is true.

files.Title: WsusManager.App.Views.SyncProfileDialog
files.Summary: Sync profile selection dialog. Returns the selected SyncProfile via the SelectedProfile property.

files.Title: WsusManager.App.Views.TransferDialog
files.Summary: Transfer dialog for Export/Import operations. Collects all parameters before operation begins -- no interactive prompts during execution.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Infrastructure.IProcessRunner
files.Summary: Interface for external process execution. All shell commands (wsusutil, netsh, sc, schtasks, etc.) go through this interface for testability.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Infrastructure.ProcessRunner
files.Summary: Centralized external process execution. All shell commands flow through here for consistent logging, cancellation, and output capture. On cancellation, the entire process tree is killed to prevent orphan child processes.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Logging.ILogService
files.Summary: Logging service interface for structured logging to C:\WSUS\Logs. Wraps the underlying Serilog implementation for DI injection and testability.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Logging.LogService
files.Summary: Serilog-based structured logging service. Writes daily rolling log files to C:\WSUS\Logs\WsusManager-{Date}.log with detailed structured entries suitable for remote troubleshooting on air-gapped servers.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Models.AppSettings
files.Summary: Application settings model. Serialized to/from JSON at %APPDATA%\WsusManager\settings.json. Survives close/reopen cycles.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Models.CheckStatus
files.Summary: Status of a single diagnostic check.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Models.ClientDiagnosticResult
files.Summary: Snapshot of WSUS client configuration and state on a remote host, gathered from the Windows Update registry hive, service control manager, and WMI.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Models.ConnectivityTestResult
files.Summary: Result of a network connectivity test from the client host to the WSUS server. Ports are tested with a TCP connection attempt; latency is measured via ping.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Models.DashboardData
files.Summary: Holds all data collected during a dashboard refresh cycle. Populated by IDashboardService.CollectAsync().

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Models.DiagnosticCheckResult
files.Summary: Result of a single health check. Each check has a name, status, detail message, and optional repair outcome if auto-repair was attempted.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Models.DiagnosticReport
files.Summary: Aggregate result of a full diagnostics run. Contains all individual check results and computed summary statistics. Immutable — created once after all checks complete.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Models.ExportOptions
files.Summary: Options for WSUS content export operations.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Models.ImportOptions
files.Summary: Options for WSUS content import operations.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Models.InstallOptions
files.Summary: Options for the WSUS + SQL Server Express installation wizard. All fields are collected via the GUI dialog before installation begins.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Models.OperationResult<T>
files.Summary: Generic version of OperationResult that includes a data payload.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Models.OperationResult
files.Summary: Represents the result of a service operation. Every public service method returns this type instead of throwing exceptions for expected failures. Exceptions are reserved for programming errors only.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Models.ProcessResult
files.Summary: Result of an external process execution.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Models.ScheduleType
files.Summary: Schedule frequency for a Windows scheduled task.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Models.ScheduledTaskOptions
files.Summary: Options for creating a Windows scheduled task for WSUS maintenance. All fields are collected via the ScheduleTaskDialog before task creation.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Models.ServiceStatusInfo
files.Summary: Status snapshot of a Windows service at a point in time.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Models.SyncProfile
files.Summary: Sync profile selection for Online Sync operations. Matches legacy PowerShell MaintenanceProfile parameter.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Models.SyncResult
files.Summary: Result of a WSUS synchronization operation.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Models.WsusErrorCodes
files.Summary:
Static dictionary of common WSUS and Windows Update error codes with descriptions and recommended fixes. Used by the error-code lookup feature (CLI-06).

Keys are uppercase hex codes without the "0x" prefix (e.g., "80244010"). The method accepts either format.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Models.WsusErrorInfo
files.Summary: Decoded information for a WSUS or Windows Update error code. Sourced from the WsusErrorCodes static dictionary.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.ClientService
files.Summary: Implements remote WSUS client management operations via WinRM. All remote operations check WinRM availability before executing and return clear failure messages when the target is unreachable.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.ContentResetService
files.Summary: Runs wsusutil.exe reset via IProcessRunner to re-verify content files. The wsusutil executable is located at C:\Program Files\Update Services\Tools\wsusutil.exe. Output is streamed to the progress reporter. No timeout is applied.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.DashboardService
files.Summary: Collects dashboard data from the local system: Windows services, SQL database size, disk space, scheduled task status, and internet connectivity. All queries use async patterns and timeouts to avoid blocking the UI.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.DatabaseBackupService
files.Summary: Implements database backup and restore operations for the WSUS SUSDB. Backup uses SQL BACKUP DATABASE with compression. Restore uses the full workflow: verify, stop services, single-user, restore, multi-user, wsusutil postinstall, restart services. Both operations require SQL sysadmin permissions.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.DeepCleanupService
files.Summary: Implements the 6-step WSUS deep cleanup pipeline. Matches the PowerShell WsusDatabase.psm1 implementation exactly, including SQL batch sizes, retry logic, and progress format.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.ExportService
files.Summary: Exports WSUS content to external media using robocopy. Supports full and differential export modes.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.FirewallService
files.Summary: Firewall rule management via netsh advfirewall commands. Checks for and creates inbound rules on WSUS ports 8530 (HTTP) and 8531 (HTTPS).

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.GpoDeploymentService
files.Summary: Copies GPO deployment files from the application's DomainController/ directory to C:\WSUS\WSUS GPO\ and returns structured instruction text for the DC admin.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.HealthService
files.Summary: Orchestrates the full 12-check diagnostics pipeline matching the PowerShell Invoke-WsusDiagnostics check list. Auto-repair is always on (matches GUI behavior). Each check streams its result to the progress reporter as it completes.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.ImportService
files.Summary: Imports WSUS content from external media to the local WSUS content directory.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.InstallationService
files.Summary: Validates installation prerequisites and launches the legacy Install-WsusWithSqlExpress.ps1 script via IProcessRunner in non-interactive mode. This is the only operation that deliberately shells out to PowerShell -- the install script is complex and re-implementing in C# provides no benefit.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.Interfaces.IClientService
files.Summary: Provides client machine management operations for WSUS-managed endpoints. All remote operations use WinRM (Invoke-Command) to execute PowerShell on the target host. If WinRM is unavailable, callers should direct users to the Script Generator in Phase 15.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.Interfaces.IContentResetService
files.Summary: Runs wsusutil.exe reset to re-verify WSUS content files against the database. Used after air-gap database import to fix "content is still downloading" status. No timeout is applied — wsusutil reset can take 10+ minutes on large content stores.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.Interfaces.IDashboardService
files.Summary: Collects system state data for the dashboard: service statuses, database size, disk space, scheduled task status, and connectivity. All queries are async and non-blocking.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.Interfaces.IDatabaseBackupService
files.Summary: Provides backup and restore operations for the WSUS SUSDB database. All operations require SQL sysadmin permissions (hard-blocked otherwise).

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.Interfaces.IDeepCleanupService
files.Summary:
Orchestrates the full 6-step WSUS deep cleanup pipeline. Steps match the PowerShell WsusDatabase.psm1 implementation:

  1. WSUS built-in cleanup (Invoke-WsusServerCleanup via PowerShell)
  2. Remove supersession records for declined updates
  3. Remove supersession records for superseded updates (10k batches)
  4. Delete declined updates via spDeleteUpdate (100/batch)
  5. Rebuild fragmented indexes + update statistics
  6. Shrink database (3 retries on backup-block).

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.Interfaces.IExportService
files.Summary: Exports WSUS content to external media. Supports full export (all content) and differential export (files modified within N days with Year/Month archive structure). Both modes use IRobocopyService for content copy.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.Interfaces.IFirewallService
files.Summary: Manages WSUS firewall rules for ports 8530 (HTTP) and 8531 (HTTPS). Uses netsh advfirewall commands via IProcessRunner for compatibility with all Windows Server versions (no managed firewall API required).

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.Interfaces.IGpoDeploymentService
files.Summary: Service for copying GPO deployment files from the application's DomainController/ directory to C:\WSUS\WSUS GPO\ and returning step-by-step instructions for the DC admin.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.Interfaces.IHealthService
files.Summary: Orchestrates the full diagnostics pipeline. Runs all health checks sequentially, streams each result to the progress reporter in real time, and automatically attempts repairs for fixable issues. Returns a complete DiagnosticReport.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.Interfaces.IImportService
files.Summary: Imports WSUS content from external media (USB drive, network share) to the local WSUS content directory. Uses IRobocopyService for file copy and optionally runs content reset via IContentResetService after import.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.Interfaces.IInstallationService
files.Summary: Service for installing WSUS with SQL Server Express. Validates prerequisites and launches the legacy PowerShell install script in non-interactive mode with parameters collected via the GUI dialog.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.Interfaces.IPermissionsService
files.Summary: Checks and repairs WSUS content directory permissions and SQL login permissions. Content path checks verify NETWORK SERVICE and IIS_IUSRS ACLs. SQL checks query server role membership and login existence.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.Interfaces.IRobocopyService
files.Summary: Runs robocopy.exe with standardized WSUS export/import options. Mirrors the PowerShell Invoke-WsusRobocopy function: /E /XO /MT:16 /R:2 /W:5 /NP /NDL, excludes *.bak *.log files and Logs SQLDB Backup directories. Interprets robocopy exit codes correctly (0-7 = success, 8+ = error).

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.Interfaces.IScheduledTaskService
files.Summary: Service for managing Windows scheduled tasks for WSUS maintenance. Uses schtasks.exe via IProcessRunner for task creation, querying, and deletion.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.Interfaces.IScriptGeneratorService
files.Summary: Generates self-contained PowerShell scripts for WSUS client operations. Use this service when WinRM is unavailable on a target host — the generated script can be copied to the target and run manually as Administrator.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.Interfaces.ISettingsService
files.Summary: Persists and loads application settings from %APPDATA%\WsusManager\settings.json.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.Interfaces.ISqlService
files.Summary: Centralized SQL execution service for all WSUS database operations. Manages connection string construction, TrustServerCertificate handling, and timeout configuration. All methods accept CancellationToken and configurable CommandTimeout (0 = unlimited for maintenance queries).

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.Interfaces.ISyncService
files.Summary:
Orchestrates the full Online Sync workflow using IWsusServerService. Three profiles match legacy PowerShell behavior:

  • Full Sync: synchronize -> decline -> approve -> monitor downloads
  • Quick Sync: synchronize -> approve (skip decline)
  • Sync Only: synchronize metadata only.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.Interfaces.IWindowsServiceManager
files.Summary: Manages Windows service lifecycle for WSUS-related services. Handles dependency ordering (SQL first, then IIS, then WSUS for start; reverse for stop). All methods return OperationResult — they do not throw for expected service failures.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.Interfaces.IWsusServerService
files.Summary: Service for connecting to and operating on the local WSUS server via the Microsoft.UpdateServices.Administration managed API. The API assembly ships with the WSUS role and is loaded at runtime via Assembly.LoadFrom to avoid compile-time dependencies on machines without WSUS installed.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.PermissionsService
files.Summary: Checks and repairs WSUS content directory permissions and SQL login permissions. Content permissions use System.Security.AccessControl for checking and icacls for repair. SQL checks use Microsoft.Data.SqlClient with integrated security (Integrated Security=True).

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.RobocopyService
files.Summary: Runs robocopy.exe with standardized WSUS options for content transfer. Mirrors the PowerShell Invoke-WsusRobocopy function exactly.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.ScheduledTaskService
files.Summary: Creates, queries, and deletes Windows scheduled tasks using schtasks.exe via IProcessRunner. Uses schtasks.exe instead of COM TaskScheduler API -- simpler, no NuGet dependency, and works reliably on Server 2019.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.ScriptGeneratorService
files.Summary:
Generates self-contained PowerShell scripts for WSUS client operations. Each generated script:

  • Requires administrator privileges (#Requires -RunAsAdministrator)
  • Is fully self-contained with no module imports or external dependencies
  • Uses Write-Host with colours for readable output
  • Ends with a "Press Enter" pause so the admin can read results.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.SettingsService
files.Summary: Settings service that persists application settings to JSON at %APPDATA%\WsusManager\settings.json.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.SqlService
files.Summary: Centralized SQL execution service for WSUS database operations. All connection strings use Integrated Security and TrustServerCertificate. Operations with commandTimeoutSeconds = 0 run with unlimited timeout — required for maintenance queries (index rebuild, shrink, batch deletes).

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.SyncService
files.Summary: Orchestrates Online Sync workflows by composing IWsusServerService operations according to the selected sync profile.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.WinRmExecutor
files.Summary:
Executes PowerShell commands on remote hosts using WinRM (Invoke-Command). Delegates to to invoke powershell.exe.

WinRM availability note: WinRM is not guaranteed to be enabled on target hosts, especially in locked-down environments. Every method returns a graceful error result if the connection fails rather than throwing. Callers should direct users to the Script Generator (Phase 15) when WinRM is unavailable.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.WindowsServiceManager
files.Summary: Manages Windows services for WSUS using System.ServiceProcess.ServiceController. Service dependency order for start: SQL(1) -> IIS(2) -> WSUS(3). Service dependency order for stop: WSUS(1) -> IIS(2) -> SQL(3). Retry logic: 3 attempts with 5-second delays for service start failures.

files.Title: WsusManager.Core.Services.WsusServerService
files.Summary: Connects to the local WSUS server via the Microsoft.UpdateServices.Administration managed API loaded at runtime. All WSUS API calls are blocking, so they are wrapped in Task.Run to keep the UI responsive.
